title: Types of Conflict Quiz
description: Identify the different types of conflict that drive stories, from person vs. person to person vs. self

questions.question: What is 'conflict' in a story?
options: A struggle or problem that drives the plot forward

questions.question: A hero battling a villain is an example of which type of conflict?
A character struggling to survive a hurricane is an example of:
A character wrestling with their own guilt or moral dilemma is an example of:
A character fighting against unjust laws or social norms is an example of:
In 'Moby Dick,' Captain Ahab's obsessive hunt for the white whale represents:
options: Person vs. Nature (and Person vs. Self)

questions.question: Person vs. Technology conflict involves:
options: Characters struggling against machines, artificial intelligence, or technology gone wrong
Characters fighting each other with technology
Characters who cannot use a telephone
An author who uses a typewriter

questions.question: Which novel features a strong 'Person vs. Society' conflict?
options: The Old Man and the Sea

questions.question: Person vs. Fate (or Person vs. Destiny) conflicts are common in:
What is 'internal conflict'?
options: A struggle that takes place within a character's mind or heart

questions.question: What is 'external conflict'?
options: A struggle between a character and an outside force
The author's disagreement with a publisher

questions.question: In 'The Old Man and the Sea,' Santiago's battle with the giant marlin is primarily:
Hamlet's famous 'To be or not to be' soliloquy reflects which type of conflict?
Can a story have more than one type of conflict?
options: Only in plays, not in novels
Yes, most complex stories contain multiple types of conflict
No, every story has exactly one conflict
Only if the story is very long

questions.question: In Mary Shelley's 'Frankenstein,' the creature's rejection by society represents:
